Name: market for sodium dithionite, anhydrous | sodium dithionite, anhydrous | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18437/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'sodium dithionite, anhydrous', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;sodium dithionite, anhydrous'  is an inorganic substance with a CAS no. : 007775-14-6. It is called 'sodium dithionite, anhydrous' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: Na2O4S2. It is solid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure and appears as a grayish-white crystalline powder with a weak sulfurous odour. It is soluble in water. It is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: textile treatment products and dyes. There is no publicly available information about the consumption of this substance on industrial sites.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sodium dithionite, anhydrous',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'sodium dithionite, anhydrous',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
